description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = p(r), where r is the (n-k+1)-th number such that A001222(r+1) = k, and p(r) is the r-th prime.
comments: The first column is A055003 and the main diagonal is A051438. When viewed as a sequence, this is a permutation of the prime numbers.
example: a(14) = T(5,4) = p(23) = 83 because A001222(23+1) = A001222(24) = 4 since 24 has four prime factors, and this is the (5-4+1) = 2nd number with A001222 = 4.The table begins:23  57  11 1713 19 31 4729 23 59 83  12737 41 67 149 211 307...
maple: with(numtheory): A050298ind := proc(n,k) option remember: local f,m: if(n=k)then return 2^n-1: fi: for m from procname(n-1,k)+1 do if(bigomega(m+1)=k)then return m: fi: od: end: for n from 1 to 6 do seq(ithprime(A050298ind(n,k)),k=1..n);od; # Nathaniel Johnston, May 07 2011
author: _Alford Arnold_, Apr 09 2003
extensions: Better name and extended by _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 07 2011
